Building a Todo App

Learn PhilJS fundamentals by building a complete todo application with signals, effects, and local storage persistence.

What We'll Build

In this tutorial, we'll create a fully functional todo app that demonstrates:

  • Reactive state management with signals
  • Component composition and props
  • User input handling with forms
  • Side effects for local storage persistence
  • Conditional rendering and lists
  • Event handling and computed values

Project Setup

First, create a new PhilJS project:

Terminal
$npm create philjs@latest todo-app
$cd todo-app
$npm install
$npm run dev

This creates a new project with TypeScript, Vite, and all the dependencies you need.

Defining the Data Structure

Let's start by defining our todo item type. Create a new file src/types.ts:

src/types.tstypescript
1export interface Todo {
2  id: string;
3  text: string;
4  completed: boolean;
5  createdAt: number;
6}
7 
8export type TodoFilter = 'all' | 'active' | 'completed';

Setting Up State

Now let's create the main component with our reactive state. Update src/App.tsx:

src/App.tsxtypescript
1import { createSignal, createMemo, createEffect, For, Show } from 'philjs-core';
2import type { Todo, TodoFilter } from './types';
3 
4function App() {
5  const [todos, setTodos] = createSignal<Todo[]>([]);
6  const [filter, setFilter] = createSignal<TodoFilter>('all');
7  const [inputValue, setInputValue] = createSignal('');
8 
9  // Computed values
10  const filteredTodos = createMemo(() => {
11    const currentFilter = filter();
12    const allTodos = todos();
13 
14    switch (currentFilter) {
15      case 'active':
16        return allTodos.filter(todo => !todo.completed);
17      case 'completed':
18        return allTodos.filter(todo => todo.completed);
19      default:
20        return allTodos;
21    }
22  });
23 
24  const activeCount = createMemo(() =>
25    todos().filter(todo => !todo.completed).length
26  );
27 
28  const completedCount = createMemo(() =>
29    todos().filter(todo => todo.completed).length
30  );
31 
32  return (
33    <div className="container">
34      <h1>PhilJS Todo App</h1>
35      {/* We'll add the UI components next */}
36    </div>
37  );
38}
39 
40export default App;
i

Signals vs Memos

createSignal creates writable reactive state, while createMemo creates derived computed values that automatically update when their dependencies change.

Adding Todos

Let's implement the functionality to add new todos:

src/App.tsxtypescript
1  // Add this function inside the App component
2  const addTodo = (e: Event) => {
3    e.preventDefault();
4    const text = inputValue().trim();
5 
6    if (!text) return;
7 
8    const newTodo: Todo = {
9      id: crypto.randomUUID(),
10      text,
11      completed: false,
12      createdAt: Date.now(),
13    };
14 
15    setTodos(prev => [...prev, newTodo]);
16    setInputValue('');
17  };
18 
19  // Add the form to the JSX
20  return (
21    <div className="container">
22      <h1>PhilJS Todo App</h1>
23 
24      <form onSubmit={addTodo} className="todo-form">
25        <input
26          type="text"
27          value={inputValue()}
28          onInput={(e) => setInputValue(e.currentTarget.value)}
29          placeholder="What needs to be done?"
30          className="todo-input"
31        />
32        <button type="submit" className="add-button">
33          Add Todo
34        </button>
35      </form>
36    </div>
37  );

Displaying Todos

Now let's render the list of todos using the For component for efficient list rendering:

src/App.tsxtypescript
1  const toggleTodo = (id: string) => {
2    setTodos(prev =>
3      prev.map(todo =>
4        todo.id === id
5          ? { ...todo, completed: !todo.completed }
6          : todo
7      )
8    );
9  };
10 
11  const deleteTodo = (id: string) => {
12    setTodos(prev => prev.filter(todo => todo.id !== id));
13  };
14 
15  return (
16    <div className="container">
17      <h1>PhilJS Todo App</h1>
18 
19      <form onSubmit={addTodo} className="todo-form">
20        <input
21          type="text"
22          value={inputValue()}
23          onInput={(e) => setInputValue(e.currentTarget.value)}
24          placeholder="What needs to be done?"
25          className="todo-input"
26        />
27        <button type="submit" className="add-button">
28          Add Todo
29        </button>
30      </form>
31 
32      <Show when={todos().length > 0}>
33        <ul className="todo-list">
34          <For each={filteredTodos()}>
35            {(todo) => (
36              <li className={`todo-item ${todo.completed ? 'completed' : ''}`}>
37                <input
38                  type="checkbox"
39                  checked={todo.completed}
40                  onChange={() => toggleTodo(todo.id)}
41                  className="todo-checkbox"
42                />
43                <span className="todo-text">{todo.text}</span>
44                <button
45                  onClick={() => deleteTodo(todo.id)}
46                  className="delete-button"
47                >
48                  Delete
49                </button>
50              </li>
51            )}
52          </For>
53        </ul>
54      </Show>
55    </div>
56  );
i

Why Use For?

The For component is optimized for rendering lists in PhilJS. It only re-renders items that have actually changed, unlike map() which re-renders the entire list.

Adding Filters

Let's add filter buttons to show all, active, or completed todos:

src/App.tsxtypescript
1  return (
2    <div className="container">
3      <h1>PhilJS Todo App</h1>
4 
5      <form onSubmit={addTodo} className="todo-form">
6        {/* ... form code ... */}
7      </form>
8 
9      <Show when={todos().length > 0}>
10        <div className="filters">
11          <button
12            className={`filter-btn ${filter() === 'all' ? 'active' : ''}`}
13            onClick={() => setFilter('all')}
14          >
15            All ({todos().length})
16          </button>
17          <button
18            className={`filter-btn ${filter() === 'active' ? 'active' : ''}`}
19            onClick={() => setFilter('active')}
20          >
21            Active ({activeCount()})
22          </button>
23          <button
24            className={`filter-btn ${filter() === 'completed' ? 'active' : ''}`}
25            onClick={() => setFilter('completed')}
26          >
27            Completed ({completedCount()})
28          </button>
29        </div>
30 
31        <ul className="todo-list">
32          {/* ... todo list code ... */}
33        </ul>
34      </Show>
35    </div>
36  );

Local Storage Persistence

Now let's add persistence with local storage using effects:

src/App.tsxtypescript
1function App() {
2  const [todos, setTodos] = createSignal<Todo[]>([]);
3  const [filter, setFilter] = createSignal<TodoFilter>('all');
4  const [inputValue, setInputValue] = createSignal('');
5 
6  // Load todos from local storage on mount
7  createEffect(() => {
8    const stored = localStorage.getItem('philjs-todos');
9    if (stored) {
10      try {
11        const parsed = JSON.parse(stored);
12        setTodos(parsed);
13      } catch (error) {
14        console.error('Failed to parse stored todos:', error);
15      }
16    }
17  });
18 
19  // Save todos to local storage whenever they change
20  createEffect(() => {
21    const current = todos();
22    localStorage.setItem('philjs-todos', JSON.stringify(current));
23  });
24 
25  // ... rest of the component
26}
!

Effect Timing

The first effect runs only once on mount (no dependencies tracked), while the second effect runs whenever todos() changes because we read it inside the effect.

Complete Code

Here's the complete App.tsx with all features:

src/App.tsxtypescript
1import { createSignal, createMemo, createEffect, For, Show } from 'philjs-core';
2import type { Todo, TodoFilter } from './types';
3import './App.css';
4 
5function App() {
6  const [todos, setTodos] = createSignal<Todo[]>([]);
7  const [filter, setFilter] = createSignal<TodoFilter>('all');
8  const [inputValue, setInputValue] = createSignal('');
9 
10  // Load from local storage
11  createEffect(() => {
12    const stored = localStorage.getItem('philjs-todos');
13    if (stored) {
14      try {
15        setTodos(JSON.parse(stored));
16      } catch (error) {
17        console.error('Failed to parse stored todos:', error);
18      }
19    }
20  });
21 
22  // Save to local storage
23  createEffect(() => {
24    localStorage.setItem('philjs-todos', JSON.stringify(todos()));
25  });
26 
27  // Computed values
28  const filteredTodos = createMemo(() => {
29    const currentFilter = filter();
30    const allTodos = todos();
31 
32    switch (currentFilter) {
33      case 'active':
34        return allTodos.filter(todo => !todo.completed);
35      case 'completed':
36        return allTodos.filter(todo => todo.completed);
37      default:
38        return allTodos;
39    }
40  });
41 
42  const activeCount = createMemo(() =>
43    todos().filter(todo => !todo.completed).length
44  );
45 
46  const completedCount = createMemo(() =>
47    todos().filter(todo => todo.completed).length
48  );
49 
50  // Actions
51  const addTodo = (e: Event) => {
52    e.preventDefault();
53    const text = inputValue().trim();
54 
55    if (!text) return;
56 
57    const newTodo: Todo = {
58      id: crypto.randomUUID(),
59      text,
60      completed: false,
61      createdAt: Date.now(),
62    };
63 
64    setTodos(prev => [...prev, newTodo]);
65    setInputValue('');
66  };
67 
68  const toggleTodo = (id: string) => {
69    setTodos(prev =>
70      prev.map(todo =>
71        todo.id === id
72          ? { ...todo, completed: !todo.completed }
73          : todo
74      )
75    );
76  };
77 
78  const deleteTodo = (id: string) => {
79    setTodos(prev => prev.filter(todo => todo.id !== id));
80  };
81 
82  const clearCompleted = () => {
83    setTodos(prev => prev.filter(todo => !todo.completed));
84  };
85 
86  return (
87    <div className="container">
88      <h1>PhilJS Todo App</h1>
89 
90      <form onSubmit={addTodo} className="todo-form">
91        <input
92          type="text"
93          value={inputValue()}
94          onInput={(e) => setInputValue(e.currentTarget.value)}
95          placeholder="What needs to be done?"
96          className="todo-input"
97        />
98        <button type="submit" className="add-button">
99          Add Todo
100        </button>
101      </form>
102 
103      <Show when={todos().length > 0}>
104        <div className="filters">
105          <button
106            className={`filter-btn ${filter() === 'all' ? 'active' : ''}`}
107            onClick={() => setFilter('all')}
108          >
109            All ({todos().length})
110          </button>
111          <button
112            className={`filter-btn ${filter() === 'active' ? 'active' : ''}`}
113            onClick={() => setFilter('active')}
114          >
115            Active ({activeCount()})
116          </button>
117          <button
118            className={`filter-btn ${filter() === 'completed' ? 'active' : ''}`}
119            onClick={() => setFilter('completed')}
120          >
121            Completed ({completedCount()})
122          </button>
123        </div>
124 
125        <ul className="todo-list">
126          <For each={filteredTodos()}>
127            {(todo) => (
128              <li className={`todo-item ${todo.completed ? 'completed' : ''}`}>
129                <input
130                  type="checkbox"
131                  checked={todo.completed}
132                  onChange={() => toggleTodo(todo.id)}
133                  className="todo-checkbox"
134                />
135                <span className="todo-text">{todo.text}</span>
136                <button
137                  onClick={() => deleteTodo(todo.id)}
138                  className="delete-button"
139                >
140                  Delete
141                </button>
142              </li>
143            )}
144          </For>
145        </ul>
146 
147        <Show when={completedCount() > 0}>
148          <button onClick={clearCompleted} className="clear-completed">
149            Clear Completed ({completedCount()})
150          </button>
151        </Show>
152      </Show>
153    </div>
154  );
155}
156 
157export default App;

Next Steps

Congratulations! You've built a complete todo app with PhilJS. Here are some ideas to enhance it further:

  • Add todo editing functionality
  • Implement drag-and-drop reordering
  • Add due dates and priorities
  • Create categories or tags
  • Add animations and transitions
  • Implement keyboard shortcuts
  • Add a dark mode toggle
  • Sync with a backend API
